name: Mount Roberts

trails_config.name: Mount Roberts Trail
trails_config.description: A gem of the Lakes Region, the Mount Roberts Trail begins at the Castle in the Clouds Conservation Area and follows old carriage roads and a well-graded trail up the ridgeline. Numerous ledgy viewpoints along the way offer wonderful views of Lake Winnipesaukee and the Belknap Mountains. The moderate effort leads to Mount Roberts’ open summit ledges, which provide an excellent panorama. This hike is known for wildflowers in spring and blueberries in summer, and is a must-do for its view-to-effort ratio.
trails_config.parking_info: Ossipee Park Rd (Castle in the Clouds), across from bottling plant

current_conditions.ai_summary: A spectacular hike located in New Hampshire. Standing at 2582 feet, Mount Roberts offers breathtaking views and a rewarding challenge for hikers of all levels.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 2582 feet, Mount Roberts is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Mount Roberts Trail**, a **5.0 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **local peak challenge**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Mount Rowe**, which is just 9.7 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
